course.subject: MATH
course.name: Introduction to Differential Equations
course.description: First order equations and applications, second order equations, Laplace transform method, series solutions, system of linear equations, nonlinear equations and linear stability analysis, introduction to partial differentiation and partial differential equations, separation of variables, and Fourier series.
course.prerequisites: A passing grade in AL Pure Mathematics / AL Applied Mathematics; OR MATH 1014 OR MATH 1020 OR MATH 1024
course.exclusions: MATH 2350, MATH 2352, PHYS 2124

reviews.author: AceOfSpades
reviews.title: An easy-to-understand MATH couse
reviews.comment_content:
First-order ODE：
1. Separable Differential Equations
2. Homogeneous Differential Equations
3. Non-homogeneous Differential Equations

Second-order ODE：
1. Homogeneous Differential Equations
2. Non-homogeneous Differential Equations
3. Laplace Transform
4. Power Series

- System of Differential Equations
● Stability of Fixed Points
- Fourier Series
- Partial Differentiation
● Separable Equations
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Mu explains stuff quite clearly. However, I wouldn't suggest reading the Powerpoint slides, as it can be hard to understand and the examples may be a bit too easy compared to exam level.

As it is an online tutorial, not many people attended. In the end the tutor decided to cancel my tutorial section (which is on Friday afternoons) due to lack of attendees.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since there aren't a lot of topics and they are relatively easy to understand compared to other courses, it is easy to pass. I'm at average in both mid-terms and final exam.
But the method they used during exams could be a bit inconvenient. To protect their exam papers from being leaked, the professor will share his screen so everyone can view the online exam pdf. If you need to view the questions, you have to tell him via Zoom. For this reason, I strongly suggest using snipping tools to screenshot the questions and save them somewhere else, so you can freely view any question without disturbing others (if classes continue to be conducted online).
reviews.comment_workload: There are 6 homework assignments total, one per approximately 2 weeks and 6 problems per homework. Different from previous MATH courses, we do not use online websites such as Webwork to hand them in. Instead, you need to included steps for every question (which costs 2 marks each), which is good. Their grading is very flexible. As long as your final answer is correct, I don't think steps really matter haha XD

reviews.author: Maisy
reviews.comment_content:
1. Ordinary Differential Equation
- First Order
- Second Order (Homogeneous/ Non-homogeneous)
2. Laplace Transform
3. Systems of First Order Linear Equations
(4. Partial Differential Equation) <-not tested in final exam
reviews.comment_teaching:
9AM lectures, I will attend the lecture if I can wake up on time.
I think only attending tutorial class will be enough for understanding the contents and application of it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two schemes are applied:
1. HW (10%), Mid-term (30%), Final (60%)
2. Mid-term (35%), Final (65%)
The higher score from one of the schemes will be the final grade for this course.

Statistics:
Mid-term (mean 54.69/100)
Final (mean 51.62/100)
I got 94.8% in my final grading, turns out it is an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are only 6 assignments in the whole semester. If you are confident enough in your performance of the exams, you don’t need to hand in any assignments since there are two grading schemes. Workload is very light.
For both of the exams, time is a little bit tight if you have very detailed steps and tried to “proof-read” your answers. You need to have a very clear mind in solving the problems and to be very careful in calculations so that even if you don’t have enough time to check your steps and answers, you can still get a high score.

reviews.author: Spencer
reviews.title: semi decent experience
reviews.comment_content: I would say you need to go to class in order to maintain decent grade. While the content isn't boring, the teacher is kinda boring in of himself. I would say that personal research would benefit you.
reviews.comment_teaching: Seems knowledgeable.
reviews.comment_grading: Grades hard. Prepare yourself for many nights studying and reviewing past lecture notes as well as Google.
reviews.comment_workload: I studied a considerable amount for this class and was able to earn an A but not far from B average. I came here from America and the workload was much heavier here than in the states.

reviews.author: candicechu
reviews.comment_content:
1.Introduction
2. First Order Equations
3.Second Order Linear Equations
4.Series Solutions of Second Order Linear Equations
5. Laplace Transform
6. Systems of First Order Linear Equations

6份assignment
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture focus on illustrating the concepts of the course content.
Tutorials focus on examples and problem solving skills.

其實完全冇上過九點lecture， 都冇上過tutorial，video 都冇睇過。
全部靠自己睇notes.

唔上lecture，其中一個原因係太早啦，第二個原因就係口音問題啦，表示聼唔明prof. 講嘅英文 ;(  ;(  ;(  
（唔係佢講得差，係我英文廢）
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: 10%
Midterm Exam: 30%
Final Exam: 60%

Homework: full mark
Midterm: 73/100  (mean:70.1)
Final Exam： 87/100  (mean: 65.6)

完全自學，最後都有A range， 所以呢科係唔會好難嘅。
數學底好嘅你，不妨可以試下呢科。
就算對數學冇咩信心嘅你，竟然入到 UST，我覺得你都duck.
reviews.comment_workload: 大概一星期一份assignment，之後冇其他要做啦。所以workload好細嘅

reviews.author: clhappy
reviews.title: Rubbish Lecturer....
reviews.comment_content:
—First ODE
—Second ODE (homo+non homogenous eq)
—Power Series (use to solve first and second ode)
—Laplace Transform
—Heat, Wave, Laplace Equations (Partial differential eq)
—System of eq


Mostly, the course is to solve first and second ode, and the other topics are different tools to solve. Before mid term, the method to solve odes are simple and easy. After mid term, the method is more difficlt to do. (start from power series).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring Teaching
Flat and low voice
poor notes, many mistakes and always modify notes->some students may need to print the same notes again
reviews.comment_grading:
webwork+tutorial quiz 20%
mid term: 25%
final: 55%

mid term: 48/55, mean 35.61
final: 66/100, mean 38.2

Total%: 78.15/100, mean, 50sth, sd: 20sth
my total% was above mean 1 sd, A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
5-6 webworks
4 questions from tutorial class

reviews.author: gossipgirl
reviews.comment_content:
Usual Content - ODE, Laplace Transforms, 2nd order DE, Homogenous and Non-Homogenous Eqns,
Boundary Value Problems.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very bad teaching. One of the worst lecturers in the math department. Slides are very difficult to read.
It is said that this is one of the easiest 2xxx math courses, however its badly taught.
reviews.comment_grading:
Horrible grading too.
Scheme 1: Homework 10%, Midterm 30%, Final 60%
Scheme 2: Midterm: 35%, Final 65%

Midterm is fairly easy. Simple questions most likely already done in high school.
Final is not very difficult either - however, very long and not enough time to complete all questions.
Midterm Mean: 70%
Final Mean: 46%

Course Mean: 60% --> C+
reviews.comment_workload: Light Workload. 5-6 Homework sets.

reviews.author: Jan 9
reviews.comment_content:
First order ODEs
-Separable differential equations
-Homogeneous differential equations
-Inhomogeneous differential equations

Second order ODEs
-Homogeneous differential equations
-Inhomogeneous differential equations
-Laplace trasform
-Power series

System of differential equations
-Stability of fixed points

Fourier Series

Partial differentiation
- Separable equation

All of the content should be easily understandable if you have a fundamental background in calculus. More tricks to solve these differential equations such as the use of 'Ansatz' will be taught to you by the professor, but these new concepts should be easily grasped and understood if you have a solid understanding of calculus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching was very clear by professor Chang, and he follows the order and format of the topics as given in the Chasnov- Introduction to Differential Equations book. The professor is easily understandable, with his accent not being too thick.

Lectures consists of the professor basically transferring the content of the book to the board, and the example questions he presents on the board are the same questions as seen in the book. So anyone can just read the book if they do not want to attend the lecture. However, the professor does explain step by step how he is able to solve the differential equations, and he will very helpfully and willingly answer questions after class. The professor will often add notes of his own in addition to the content on the book in order to explain concepts more clearly, so I do find going to lectures helped me a lot.

The lessons will include the professor talking about the topic for about half a lesson, then giving students a 5 minute break, before continuing with the rest of the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
The only "not so good" thing about this course is that absolute grading is used.

My grade:
Homeworks - 98%
Midterm - 100%
Final - 90%
I received 94% for my final grade, got a letter grade of A.

Weighting:
Homeworks - 10%
Midterm - 30%
Final - 60%
reviews.comment_workload:
This course includes one piece of homework per week. The content of the homework will be the content that was taught on the previous lecture. The questions of the homework are very similar to the example equations that the professor solves in class, with values being changed slightly. So if you pay attention in class, homework should not be a problem.

The tutorials do not record attendance, and basically includes the TA explaining the answer of the homework to students. The TA would put additional practices on their website based on what has already been taught. They are are completely optional, but I find them useful.

reviews.author: YSA
reviews.comment_content:
Topics:

T1: Class intro, some math background
T2: first order ODE separable equations, method of integrating factors
T3: first order ODE applications
T4: second order homogeneous ODE, Euler's method
T5: second order inhomogenous ODE, applications
T6: Initial value problem and Laplace Transform
T7: step functions, delta functions and Laplace Transform
T8: Series solutions
T9: Euler's Equation and Linear Algebra
T10: System of first order ODE
T11: Multivariable Calculus, fixed point and stabilities
T12: Fourier Series
T13: Introduction to PDEs, separation of variables

Normal topics as expected in an introductory diff. equation course. Off-balance because the final is too difficult because it has all the topics in the entire course and the last few topics are quite difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. is alright, explains topics quite clearly with many examples. Spends most of the lecture time showing the derivations of the equations, formulas, and methods used, which are not required at all. It's fine to skip the lectures. They are recorded anyway.

The tutorials are really helpful. I had Dy Chun Yin (DDY) as the TA, he was excellent but unfortunately won't be teaching from next term onwards. Do not miss the tutorials, the practice is very helpful and also counts for 10% of the grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
Worksheets: 10%;
Midterm: 30%;
Final: 60%

Exams are very straightforward - 1 questions from each topic. 6 questions in the midterm, 12 in the final (including the 6 topics from midterm). The questions are exactly the same format as the practice questions from the lectures and tutorials.

Grading follows both curved and absolute. Your final grade depends on whichever system gives you a better grade. The absolute grading boundaries are too high (90-100 = A, 80-90 = B, 70-80 = C, etc.).

I got 73 in midterm, 58 in final, total 67%. Mean was 73%. Grade C.
reviews.comment_workload: Weekly 50 minutes tutorial, attendance at tutorials is required. No homework or assignments. But the exams require a lot of practice.

reviews.author: dd-450
reviews.comment_content:
This course mainly taught you how to solve simple 1st order and 2nd order ODE
midterm: 1st order + simple 2nd order using characteristic equations
final: 8 questions in 2hrs, 3 for 2nd order(undetermined coef, euler, varaition of parameter), 2 for power series(1 using euler method), 1 for complex eigenvalue, 1 for system of ODE and the last is Laplace transform.
The Laplace transform is really complicated, and you better go through the questions in section 6.4 of your textbook.
The others are not so difficult, just be careful. And be aware that the time is not so enough.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think it is not a must for you to attend the lecture. I think it is fairly okay for you to go through the lecture, if you dont want to go to the lecture.

IF YOU WANT TO HAVE A GOOD GRADE, PLEASE ATTEND ALL TUTORIALS!!!
really important!! If is funny that the tutorial will cover all the final materials, and the TAs will mark the final paper. They will tell you what will be tested in the final.
For example, the prof had never taught about the format of doing the system of ODE, But the TA had shown all the steps in the tutorial You just need to memorize it and paste it to your final paper, then you can get this 5 points.
So please go all the tutorials and copy down everything the TA writes.
reviews.comment_grading:
The course is quite easy, mainly some secondary level integration.

The cutoff of A range is about 80/100, it is not so "killer" as I heard from others.
reviews.comment_workload:
6 assignments for the whole semester. 1-2 hours for each
Just like your previous math hw in high school;-)

reviews.author: D.L.
reviews.title: Relatively simple math course
reviews.comment_content:
See others for syllabus.
I'm an engineering student, and the 2000-level math course I have taken are 2011, 2111 and 2351. For me, this one is definitely the easiest, even easier than 1014. Although the content itself can be quite confusing sometimes, all asignments and exams focus on calculation instead of theories. In general, you don't need a thorough understanding to perform well in the exams, as long as you know the formulas and calculation steps well. The most challanging part of the course is the time limit. Although the calculation is not always difficult, it requires a lot of steps and can be quite tedious.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Mu's teaching is okay. He is able to explain things quite clearly, though his accent is a bit heavy. Not a lot of people attend the lecture, probably because reading the slides by yourself is usually faster (at least for me). The same can be said to the tutorials this semester.
If you ask me, it should be enough to go to tutorials and read the lecture notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Just your normal ust course grading.

10% homework (most people get full)
30% midterm
60% final

My score:
Homework: full
Midterm: 70/100
mean = 68.5, median = 73, upper quartile = 85
Final: 84/100
mean = 60.22, median = 61, upper quartile = 83.75
Grade: B+

I did not practice enough for the midterm and took too long to do the questions, so I ran out of time. If you can finish the questions in time, you should do fine in the exams.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite low, honestly.
There are only 6 homeworks throughout the semester. You are required to write down the calculation steps and answers on paper, scan it and submit it online. The questions are a bit like the lecture examples but more tedious, but if you are struggling you can just google/go to math support centre.
The midterm this semester was held during lecture time with 7/8 questions (forgot the exact number). The final lasted 2 hours with 6 questions. Both only focus on calculation, and the difficulty is only a bit harder/more tedious than the homework questions. For preparation, it would be sufficient to complete all the tutorial questions and try to train your speed, as it is quite important to finish the questions quickly and accurately in the exams.

reviews.author: plsquitust
reviews.title: Not happy with this course, prof and TA do not help much
reviews.comment_content:
teach you to solve 1st order and 2nd order differential equations, there are different methods to solve to the same equation.

you may see others' comments as I don't want to repeat the content again.
reviews.comment_teaching:
bad teaching... although mu mo is keeping talking but his accent is very hard to follow. He just keeping talking about the ppt but never write down the solutions by hand. I think mu mo had better write the solution by hand and it will be easier to follow.

The TA never write down the solution by hand either, just keeping talking about the ppt. But you can email them and they reply effectively.

I learnt this course all by myself.....!!!! Prof and TA do not help much to be honest. You can just rely on the PPT and you will be ok.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not a good grade course.
Mean is B-/C+, but it is normal in UST
reviews.comment_workload:
Depends on how you view it.
Only 6 HW to do
But you need to keep practising solving the equations as the exams are examining whether you can solve the equations. Small mistakes will leads you to low scores.

reviews.author: Muski
reviews.title: The TA is really helpful and nice
reviews.comment_content: The course is an introduction to differential equations and it covers first-order and second-order differential equations with Laplace and Fourier transformation. The notes given are pretty much sufficient and the worksheets given by the TA is very helpful. It covers all the main points. If you pay attention to the tutorial you will be good to go.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The class I got enrolled in was a morning 9 am class. I never attended the lectures but I went for the tutorials. The TA Lu Yi So or Louis was the best TA. He clears all the concepts very clearly and explains how to solve different types of problems. The worksheet that he provides have various types of questions and solving them helps you to strengthen your concepts and if you have any doubt you can always meet him after class or take an appointment for any other day and clear all your doubts. He is very approachable and helpful and is always ready to help you out. Attending tutorials helps a lot.

I got an A in this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are two options for grading:
Option A: Homework: 10%; Midterm Exams: 30 %; Final Exam: 60 %
Option B: Midterm Exams: 35 %; Final Exam: 65 %

Option A is better as the homework questions are quite easy and you can score full on them. The midterm is easier and you should be able to score really well. Finals are tough as the Laplace transformation and Fourier transformation is tested but if you solve the midterm and final review worksheet uploaded by the TA you will be good to go.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not a lot. It mainly includes the 6 homework worksheets that you have to solve and submit on time. The worksheets are not lengthy and just include five to six questions. Other than that there is a midterm and a final.

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.title: Decent
reviews.comment_content:
First-order ODE：
1. Separable Differential Equations
2. Homogeneous Differential Equations
3. Non-homogeneous Differential Equations

Second-order ODE：
1. Homogeneous Differential Equations
2. Non-homogeneous Differential Equations
3. Laplace Transform
4. Power Series

- System of Differential Equations
● Stability of Fixed Points
- Fourier Series
- Partial Differentiation
● Separable Equations
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Chang is devoted to teaching. He derived and illustrated, during lessons, everything of every topic from the most fundamental, step by step and part by part. He never seemed to miss key points.

He taught us how to solve a number of sample questions, which mostly appeared in the exams. He is a typical good teacher being very willing to adjust his teaching pace in accordance with our rate of “absorption”.

He asked us at least three times a lesson whether we could catch up with what he taught, unlike many teachers who would just “teach to themselves” throughout a lesson.

Well, perhaps because the content was a bit too difficult for me, I did miss a few lessons or sleep during some of his lessons. Still, I could catch up without significant issues.

As for the TA, who revisited the lecture content in the weekly tutorial sessions, he might only be a good researcher because it was very hard to understand something from him.

Some people said that the tutorial sessions were more important than the lectures, but I disagree.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm：30%
Final：60%
Homework：10%

There was eleven homework in total, every of which consisted of a few questions based on the topic he had just finished teaching. The homework was given weekly and had to be handed in before 5 pm every Monday.

Mid-Term mean：~20/30, I only got 15/30.
Final mean：Forgot, I was about mean.
Homework：I did not hand in two homework due to exhaustion. Most of the homework I handed in was below mean, except for three out of eleven.

Yet, I managed to get C+ .

Conclusion：Good Grade
reviews.comment_workload:
The weekly assigned homework took a huge toll on me that I was almost push over the edge, particularly because I took 18 credits last semester and had other courses with tedious projects to be dealt with.

If you decide to take this course in a semester, you should avoid choosing other courses that have heavy coursework.

reviews.author: Ceci
reviews.comment_content:
First-order ODE: separable, linear
Second-order (constant coefficient) ODE: homogeneous, inhomogeneous
Laplace Transform
Laplace Transform: Heaviside, Dirac delta functions
Series solution: Cauchy-Euler Equation
System of equations
Fixed points and stability
PDE: Fourier Series, Diffusion Equation, Wave Equation
reviews.comment_teaching: There are examples in every chapter and you can understand all topics easily by reading the lecture notes/e-book yourself. I have only attended 1 lecture but still got an A-. The lectures are as boring as usual.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% assignment (my score:9/10)
30% midterm (my score: 30/30)
60% final (my score: 78/100)
absolute grading
I got 86% for an A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
one assignment per week.
You just need to spend some time to read the lecture notes in order to understand and finish the assignments.

reviews.author: dicklok
reviews.comment_content:
First-order ODE: separable, linear
Second-order (constant coefficient) ODE: homogeneous, inhomogeneous
Laplace Transform
Laplace Transform: Heaviside, Dirac delta functions
Series solution: Cauchy-Euler Equation
System of equations
Fixed points and stability
PDE: Fourier Series, Diffusion Equation, Wave Equation
reviews.comment_teaching: I think any one don't need to attend the class, because the note is too comprehensive . I think  just review the notes can get great grade in the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
absolute grading
two grading method
one is 30% midterm, 10% assignment and 60% Final
or 35% midterm and 65% final
reviews.comment_workload: no workload, because it is optional assignment

reviews.author: JK1
reviews.title: MATH 2351 is no longer a required course for chemistry student.
reviews.comment_content:
Before mid-term:
1. First-order ODE: separable, linear
2. Second-order (constant coefficient) ODE: homogeneous, inhomogeneous
3. Laplace Transform
After mid-term:
4. Laplace Transform: Heaviside, Dirac delta functions
5. Series solution: Cauchy-Euler Equation
6. System of equations
7. Fixed points and stability
8. PDE: Fourier Series, Diffusion Equation, Wave Equation
(Optional: Schrödinger equation)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. CHANG taught quite well. He provided theories rigorously but in a simple mean before teaching us how to solve the mathematical problems. (maybe he is a pure mathematician)
Attend all tutorial to get some important key point of the course (useful for preparing mid-term and final)
reviews.comment_grading:
Many strong students in this course. Easily 被人屈機 in this course.
Easy to get a pass but hard to get an A. I have got above mean in both mid-term and exam and resulted in B range.
reviews.comment_workload: Weekly homework with a few questions that took me few hours per week to do it (release in Thursday and due date is the next following Monday)

reviews.author: omega
reviews.title: worth taking
reviews.comment_content:
Laplace transformation
First and second order ODE
series
some fourier series

2016-17 spring

o   Mathematical models; Direction Fields (1.1)

reviews.comment_teaching:
ok
always laughing
clear teaching and notes , clearly tell which is not required
he can spend 15 min on 1 powerpoint page

tutorial must go
reviews.comment_grading:
A-B
i think is better than 2011
reviews.comment_workload:
light
6 homework in total , normal-hard difficulty

reviews.author: Tjtanaa
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is fun. They course content is standard. There are new topics this year for example solving partial differential equations. However, the method to find the integrating factor for non linear odes aren't taught. This year's course content is very rewarding as while learning the way to solve the partial differential equations, we are taught the way to use them to solve the Schrodinger's equation, and we are not required to know how to solve the equation.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecturer's teaching style is good. He explains the content well and covers all the important details of each of the concepts that he taught. You will be able to fully understand and how to use them. The TA also reviewed the content of the lecturers briefly and comprehensively.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is fairly good. The exam's questions weren't very hard this year and there was adequate amount of time to solve all the questions and check them through again. However, due to this situation, the marks to get A range is high as many students get good grades.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is small. There is no web work. You only have to attend the tutorial classes to get the attendance marks and the rest of the marks were contributed by the midterm exam and final exam.

reviews.author: HakuSHL
reviews.comment_content: Solutions to different type of ordinary differential equations and some partial differential equations.
reviews.comment_teaching: Since the content of this course is just the solutions to different types of equations, the lecture is actually not so interesting. Just attending the tutorial can equip you with all the knowledge you need in exam as the questions in exam is very similar to that on the worksheets.
reviews.comment_grading: This course uses both absolute and curved grading and take the better side. If you get a mean, I think you will sure get a B-range. However, you have to get 90 marks in order to get A- or above in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course in the least among all courses I have taken. You just need to attend the tutorial once per week and finish some questions on the worksheet. The TA will show you the steps of some sample problems so it is quite easy to finish the worksheet.

reviews.author: nangyo
reviews.comment_content:
First order equations, second order equations, Laplace transform method, numerical solution of initial value problems, boundary-value problems. Exclusion(s): MATH 2350, MATH 2352 Prerequisite(s): A passing grade in AL Pure Mathematics / AL Applied Mathematics; OR MATH 1014 OR MATH 1018 OR MATH 1020 OR MATH 1024

Very interesting topics if you are interested in calculus.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lectures were very interesting.
reviews.comment_grading: Absolute grading, but can be adjusted if mean is too low.
reviews.comment_workload: Concepts could be hard to understand. However, if those are understood once and practice tutorial questions, exams are not very tough. Therefore, if you know how to study for this course, workload is light.

reviews.author: 呀安
reviews.comment_content:
first, second ode (application)
Laplace's transform
System of odes
Stability
Fourier's series
PDE
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Robert just teach the example in the book which is around 120 pages only
reviews.comment_grading:
I think the grading is not that good
in this semester , the overall mean is 75%
I got 80% > B-
it is based on two way : absolute grading or relative grading
If you want to get B+ , you should have overall 88% .
However , I think it is not easy :
the full mark of midterm is 60 . If you don't know one question out of 6 (10 for each LQ ) , Let say :50/60 > only 83.3333%
Moreover , I think there is a really difficult question (different from the example in book) in the final exam .
Hence, I think getting more than 85% is not that easy unless you do all the question in tutorial + in his book + reference testbook
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not that heavy . No homework , but you have to attend the tutorial to get the homework mark . As far as I know , as long as you try to do the questions , and you will get full marks ! Also , it could ensure that you know how to solve the question (so you can spend less time to do the revision before midterm / final exam)

reviews.author: scambret
reviews.comment_content:
- first ode and application
- second ode (homogeneous and non-homogeneous)
- Laplace's transform
- Series solution
- system of odes
- fixed point and stability
- Fourier's series
- pde (very simple)
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chasnov is great. His pronunciation is perfect (of course) and he goes through very detailed on every part of the program. Also, tutorial are important because if you practice on those problems, you will finally get a high mark.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very generous grading. You just need to understand 12 types of problem included in tutorial and work through them.
Midterm and final exam questions are very similar to the one included in tutorial.
10% hw
30% midterm
60% final

If your score is > 90 --> A
If your score is > 80 --> B

If your score is > mean + sd --> A
If your score is > mean --> B

Teacher gives you the best of two possible grades.
reviews.comment_workload: Very very low. Just go to the tutorial and do your best to do a lot of problem,

reviews.author: sgargaa
reviews.title: Take honours course instead
reviews.comment_content: The content was basic, and if you have experience in calculus it should be easy. However, you are all by yourself in this course. TA and professor suck.
reviews.comment_teaching: One of the worst professors that I have had in UST so far. He does no0t know what he is speaking, and all students go to sleep in class. The others never show up, and the worst part was that the class was 9am. TA was better than the professor, but he struggled with English and often could not answer doubts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mean grade would be B- or C+. Exams are easy if you do the book. You get a choice between-
65% final and 35% midterm
OR
60% final, 30% midterm and 10% 6 homework assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is low. Occasional homework assignments that need to be done by hand. Concepts are easy if you study from book, but lecture notes are bad. Professor is bad. TA is bad. So you need to study by yourself.

reviews.author: Brendan
reviews.comment_content: Content tested in mid term is basically what they teach in high school or A-level. As for contents tested in finals, it doesn't teaches you how to solve a differential equation completely ie: finding one fundamental solution for a second order DE. Also, 3x3 system of 1st order equation was not taught. I really don't know how we can apply what we have learned in class considering we only know half of the methods to solve DEs.
reviews.comment_teaching: Unorganized, incoherent. Might as well self study.
reviews.comment_grading: In general, should be a good grade course.
reviews.comment_workload: 7 HWs, generally takes 1-2 hours to finish. Not mind numbingly difficult.

reviews.author: Byiu
reviews.title: 爛GRADE又教得差
reviews.comment_content: 主要都係教點樣去solve differential equation. 主要about First order equations, second order equations, Laplace transform method, Power series等等..
reviews.comment_teaching: 差到不得了, 佢既英文口音不在話下, 講野又唔知佢講咩, 上佐2個星期堂已經冇超過1半人上堂, 自修其實都好快就學識
reviews.comment_grading:
mean拎C, 不過如果major requirement 要讀呢科就冇得避啦, 因為呢年fall 同spring sem都係佢教

不過注意 midterm好簡單, 但final係難好多 有9題 基本係睇下邊個做得快同準就邊個高分. 即係你做得exercise多, 做得快d就高分d, 付出幾多得到幾多
所以 midterm mean about 70%, final about 43%
reviews.comment_workload: 呢科真係冇咩workload, 教既野淺, 功課又唔深, 可以話所有math course最冇workload

reviews.author: abhr
reviews.title: Pathetic Course
reviews.comment_content:
Ridiculous content. Boring lecture slides. Content could be made interesting if taught properly. Here are your options :
1. Don't take this course.
2. Take it with the other professor.
3. Be prepared for a unsatisfactory semester with this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: After doing MATH 2111 and MATH 2011, I can safely say that the teaching deserves an F but I don't see that option here. The faculty refuses to give any past papers. The professor sets a 3hr paper and asks us to solve it in 2 hrs.
reviews.comment_grading: Bad grading. Narrow grading margins. Mean of the final is very low.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. Optional HW, midterm and Final. 10,30,60.  or 35,65.

reviews.author: First_Aid_Kit
reviews.title: 2015-16 Fall
reviews.comment_content:
First Order Equations
Second Order Linear Equations
Series Solutions of Second Order Linear Equations
Laplace Transform
Systems of First Order Linear Equations
reviews.comment_teaching:
基本上lecture就無人去咁濟
上左同無上無分別
上tutorial啦
that's all
reviews.comment_grading:
above mean無1sd得B-
其實grade好爛

計grade有2個scheme
A: midterm 35% final 65%
B: homework 10% midterm 30% final 60%
reviews.comment_workload:
得6份功課無webwork
SEM頭教得唔多所以唔密
SEM中開始黎得好密

reviews.author: R_Liaw
reviews.comment_content:
First order ODE-> (linear, separable)
ay"+by'+cy=g(t)
Euler equation
Series solution of second order ODE
Laplace Transform & Stepwise function
system of First order ODE

會用返MATH1014 學過嘅partial fraction & series
要識嘅嘢其實唔算多, 都係背咗d solving method 就得

To maj Chem 嘅各位:
一定要用群眾壓力毛毛知你唔識Lin Alg & Multi Cal, 如果唔係佢會assume 你識, 然後教深好多
reviews.comment_teaching:
毛毛教得廢就預咗㗎啦
口音問題,完全聽唔明佢講咩, 我Final 嗰陣連佢講開始嗰句都聽唔出 =.=""
聽唔明都算, d powerpoint 又唔知做緊咩, d notation 又唔consistent, 一時係solve for y=f(x), 一時又變咗x=f(t), 有時用dy/dx, 有時用y'
佢上堂係白板寫嗰d 更加係世界級, 寫一樣嘢就畫十幾個圈, 又成日跳咗去另一樣嘢度, 最後塊broad 淨係得一堆打哂交叉嘅線同一堆圈圈

自己睇Textbook 仲efficient 過上堂

TA: Liu Chang
Mainland TA, 英文好過毛毛, 不過都係聽得有d吃力
頭幾堂狂係度derive d formula, 但係考試淨係要識用formula, 唔考proof
後期正常返變咗做下exercise
不過exercise 題目&solution 都可以上佢網度download, 唔上tutor 都得
TA 教學進度比較慢, Laplace Transform & System of ODE Tutorial 都教唔切(仲要唔教就連exercise 都唔upload 上網)
reviews.comment_grading:
Hw: 6份, 有做就有分 10%
Midterm: 30%
Final: 60%
Final 考哂成個sem 嘅嘢

如果唔交hw 就 Midterm: 35%, Final: 65%
因病唔考midterm 就將midterm 嘅weighting 撥落final 度

Midterm Stat
L1: Mean = 66.24, Sd = 19.01
L2: Mean = 70.05, Sd = 17.37

Final Stat
L1:    Mean 40.75, Sd 24.74
L2:    Mean 46.09, Sd 21.95

Overall >90% ->A+
聽說有人踩mean C
reviews.comment_workload:
~每2星期1份功課, 唔算好難, 跟書example 照做就得
Midterm 同homework 差唔多, 識做書exercise 就得
Final 難少少, 要識將唔同方法mix 嚟用

reviews.author: FrostyP4nc4kes
reviews.title: Exams are painful to say the least
reviews.comment_content:
The content is actually very good to know:
Ch1: solving differntial equations with calculus
Ch2: integrating factor and separation of variables
Ch3: second order ODEs
Midterm
Ch5 series solutions for second order ODEs with variable coefficients + euler equations(a lot easier than it sounds)
Ch6: laplace transform and solving second order odes with that
Ch7 systems of odes(basically just eigenvalues and vectors) not hard

This whole course can be summed up with
- integration by parts
- quadratics
- product rule abuse
- basic series manipulation
- a frick ton, and i mean a frick ton, of system of equations
You thought 3x3 matrices are annoying? well... the final will have you using matrices for 4/6 of the questions with some needing MULTIPLE 3x3, 4x4 matrices solved as intermediate steps! So good luck and have fun!

In fact the most depressing part of this course is just that its just linear algebra 2.0

I still gave this content an B because its actually useful and somewhat conceptually interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof mu is ok. He is a decent enough teacher but his explanations really require you to understand what is happening in order for you to benefit from it.

Ta is nice, but yeah make sure to ask them to use an ipad and share screen because you wont be able to see what they write on the board lol

Teaching is honestly solid this semester

Most people show up to either lectures or ta.

After taking this course, i recommend self studying and going to tutorials because the TA tells you how to answer the questions.

Prof Mu did not really explain the unit step function Laplace transform  to a point that was substantial for the exam, so extra practice and research would be required.
reviews.comment_grading:
The midterm and final are a lot harder than the in class examples. You will most likely not have enough time to do the questions.

I think my class just got so unlucky with the difficulty of the tests being significantly harder than all the past papers I've seen.

Anyway...
HW 10% nice grading, best 10 out of 12 points
Midterm 30% mean 54
Final 60% mean 49.2

Overall, the TA was very generous with the points in the final.

Aight so apparently an 81% overall gets an A-, that's aight I guess
reviews.comment_workload: Its like 1 hw every two weeks. Ch3 hw is painful tho. Just be warned. Everything else is doable in a short time.

reviews.author: xuexue
reviews.comment_content:
very simple course.
Lectures: focus on illustrating the concepts of the course content.

Tutorials: focus on examples and problem solving skills.

1.How to model and solve simple problems using first order odes;
2.How to solve linear, constant coefficient second-order odes;
3.How to use the Laplace transform method;
4.How to construct series solutions;
5.How to solve a system of linear, constant coefficient, first-order odes;
6.How to solve partial differential equations using separation of variables;
reviews.comment_teaching:
teacher focus on illustrating the concepts of the course content.
tutorial is important
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: 10%; Midterm Exam: 30 %; Final Exam: 60 %
It's easier to get good grades. Just finish the exercises given by tutorials.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 6 assignments in total, and each assignment can be easily solved.Similar to the exam topic, please take it seriously.

reviews.author: Shady
reviews.title: Fine Enough
reviews.comment_content:
Very Good and Useful Content

If you like Calculus and Differential Equations, this course is a must study for all

Direction Fields
Variable Separable
Linear Differential Equations
Homogeneous Equations with Undetermined Coefficients
Non-Homogeneous Equations with Undetermined Coefficients

These are the mid term portions

Laplace Transformation
Euler's Equations
Power Series Solution
Singular and Ordinary Points
System of Linear Equations

These are the final exam portions

Emphasis is put on after midterm portions in the final exam so focus on that :)
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is only so so
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite Harsh

Homework : 10%
Midterm : 30%
Final : 60%

Mix of Absolute and Relative ( not exactly sure how that works )

Very tough to get A+

Final Score: 93%
Final Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is very light

6 Homework Assignments

Each is due once every 10 weeks

However, mean is high in the homework assignments

reviews.author: MyVarian
reviews.comment_content: as listed by others, i don't want to repeat. but it is really interesting if you go to lecture every time because you can learn a lot of interesting things which will not be tested in exams but useful for further study and the beauty of math
reviews.comment_teaching:
very clear teaching and brilliant methods to solve the questions.
better than reading the textbooks by yourself
reviews.comment_grading:
0.3 midterm 0.1 tutorial 0.6 final
very good grade!
97+: a+
93-96: a

i got all full mark in homework(tutorials)
midterm 60/60
only use 40 min to complete, given 90 min
final 119/120
use 100min given 180 min
exams are very easy
if you know the course content, those questions are really easy
reviews.comment_workload: almost no other homework if you pay enough attention to lectures and tutorials

reviews.author: Gu Zhaoyi
reviews.title: 好龟课
reviews.comment_content: This course is all about different ways to solve differential equations. I think this course test your ability of calculation rather than comprehension of concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: kind of boring. It's very easy to get distracted and fall asleep in the class.
reviews.comment_grading: Both midterm and final are not difficult. It's okay if you make some small mistakes in your exams, you can still get good grade in the end. However, since the exams this sem are all conducted online, the invigilation is unsatisfactory. Perhaps the exam policy will be adjusted in the future.
reviews.comment_workload: No need to attend classes to be honest. Just review the course materials and finish homework every week.

reviews.author: Jonathan_ive
reviews.title: Rubbish professor ruined my grade in this course
reviews.comment_content: Some techniques are taught in this course. It is helpful, of course, for the engine students to solve the differential equations. In this course, it mainly focus on the first order and the secondary order differential equations. If you pay a lot of effort, you can get a good grade. Since i am a lazy asshole, i almost missed every lectures, and i finally get a C.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is from mainland, not handsome and old. He has two BIG PROBLEMS!!!!!!
1. His accent is quite weird.
sometime his accent impacted me a lot. Most of the time in class, I couldn't catch what he spoke. I strongly recommend him to improve his English pronunciation.

2. He is REALLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLY bad in teaching .
In class, he always tried to interact with other students, but he is a totally boring guy. Everyone just ignored him, even he said something funny. When he said a joke, but no one laugh, he would laugh in an awkward way. But Nobody would like to response him. Then i decided never attend his course, since i couldn't stand the awkward environment in this lecture. Then I learn it by myself!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
you have two options for grading.
Option A: Homework: 10%; Midterm Exams: 30 %; Final Exam: 60 %
Option B: Midterm Exams: 35 %; Final Exam: 65 %
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not really difficult.
several assignment.
one midterm
one final.

reviews.author: garbage
reviews.title: Normal.
reviews.comment_content: The content is not much. It would be better if it can include some introduction to partial differential equations.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is a bit boring, but I would still attend his lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is super nice. Actually you do not need to spend a lot of time studying for this course in order to get good grade, you just need to go over the tutorial notes and practice questions on it before the exams. Once you are pretty familiar with those questions, you would do fine because the exams would not include questions other than those on the slides.
10% homework
30% midterm mean: 65
60% final exam mean: 71
I got 87 for midterm and 100 for final, yielded an A+.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is SUPER light. Less than 2 credit actually. You just need to learn a bit every time you start doing the assignments, which are not difficult at all. You ca even Google out some of the answers.

reviews.author: chlll
reviews.title: MO MU vs HHM
reviews.comment_content:
Easy to handle

if the course covers the PDE and variation of parameters, it would be better for future courses
reviews.comment_teaching:
good lectures and suitable speed for everyone, including beginners

Comparing to MATH2011 in 2021 Fall and MATH2351 in 2021 Spring, I would say MU MO is better than Ho Hon Ming in teaching mathematics




The former is trying to illustrate all the stuff clearly and students can imagine the applications of mathematics in their interested areas, like electronic engineering, computer science, business, pure mathematics.
But the latter one only writes the mechanical steps like "Things to Do", which should not be encouraged to appear in maths courses and only let the students follow strictly with the steps without thinking.
In Chinese, what exactly mean is 活剝生吞
reviews.comment_grading:
not quite easy to get A+ for everyone


mt: 92/100, basically I can get 100/100, but not quite in the condition

final:100/100

overall: 97.6%
Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
all easy

6 Homeworks

others are assessments, midterm, and final exams

reviews.author: uraniumgun1127
reviews.title: 전체적으로 만족스러웠던 수업
reviews.comment_content:
미분방적식의 개론수업입니다. 일차미분방정식, 이차미분방정식, 라플라스변환, 대수적 해결방법, 초기조건문제, 경계값 조건 문제들을 다룹니다.

1차 미분방정식보다는 2차 미분방정식에 비중을 많이 두었고 이 방정식의 정답을 다양한 방식으로 풀어내는 데에 초점을 맟추었습니다. 푸는방법은 대표적으로 라플라스 변환, 푸리에 변환, 율러의 방법들을 소개하며 미분방정식의 적용을 학기 전체에 걸쳐 몇번씩 짚고 넘어갑니다.

전체적으로 어렵다고 느껴지지는 않습니다만 수업을 따라가기 위해 자주 복습할것과 문제풀이를 권합니다.
reviews.comment_teaching: CHIANG, yik man 님이 교수님이셨습니다. 영어를 그렇게 잘 한다고는 말 못하겠습니다. 가르치는 스타일은 약간 소극적이고 말을 중간중간에 끊으면서 애기하십니다. 약간 심심할수도 있습니다만 풀이과정을 설명하는 과정은 꽤 논리정연해서 개인적으로 맘에 든 교수님이었습니다.
reviews.comment_grading:
점수는 적당히 후하게 준다고 말할수 있겠군요.

튜토리얼 수업때 주는 문제, 수학웹워크, 중간고사, 기말고사 점수를 토대로 그레이딩이 됩니다. 중간고사는 6문제 였고 전반적으로 기출문제들이라 쉽습니다. 그러나 기말고사는 전체범위가 골고루 나오고 몇몇 심화문제와 캔바스 자료에 없는 선생님이 수업때 따로 알려주신 문제도 나옵니다, 그래서 어렵습니다.

*점수팁*

튜토리얼:
튜토리얼 수업때 랜덤한 날에 깜짝문제가 출제됩니다. 귀찮다고 땡땡이 치다가 그날 문제가 나오면 대략 전체점수 2.5%가 깍여나갑니다. 제발 꼭 가세요

웹워크:
제발 자주 확인하세요. 웹워크 보니 이미 데드라인 끝나있으면 그것만큼 허무할순 없을겁니다. 웹워크는 비정기적으로 나오고 많이 있는 편은 아닙니다만 한 세트에 문제량이 많습니다 (15~25문제). 그러니 미리미리 하세요. 시도횟수는 무한대니 거침없이 틀려도 됩니다.

중간고사:
수업만 잘따라오고 복습만 잘해도 평타이상은 나옵니다.
오직 많은 량의 문제풀이가 당신을 살릴것 입니다.

기말고사:
그동안 배웠던거 전체범위를 다루는데 중간범위도 기말범위랑 비슷한 비중으로 출제되더군요. (중간고사범위문제 6문제, 기말고사범위문제 7문제). 그리고 캔바스에는 없고 수업때만 알수 있는내용으로 출제된 문제도 있었습니다. 수업은 성실히 가시기 바랍니다.

제 등급은 A+ 입니다.
reviews.comment_workload:
적지도 많지도 않은 적당한 량입니다.
다만 튜토리얼 참석은 굉장히 귀찮다는게 흠이군요.
